page.title: 18THE GIRLS' BRIGADE
page.content: This worldwide organisation has its foundations dating back to 1900. It is a christian based inter-denominational body which aims at encouraging girls, aged 5 to 18, to physical,mental and spiritual maturity. In the Tyne-Wear region there are 20 companies each attached to a church. Company meetings are held weekly with a programme based on badge work. Older girls participate in the Duke of Edinburgh Award Scheme to encourage service in the wider community. Throughout the year there are various divisional events e.g. parades, sports, barbecues. Each summer about 100 girls and officers attend a canvas camp. Within the area there are three bugle and drum corps all of which have had success in national competition.In 1985 a massed north-east band played at the Royal Albert Hall London.
